message:
The Browser Object Model is not standardized and can change based on different browsers.

i want to know the BOM implementation for different browsers 
IE,FF,GC,Safari,Opera

data.message:
GC,Safari,Opera 
i think they have the same implementation because they are based on 
WebToolkit

ff is gecko 
ie is shit :D
all but ie use ECMA javascript

there is a lot of misunderstanding in these post and comments ,  -ECMA script is the  standards of javascript and standard over all browser depends on ECMA script version 
- Chrome and safari uses webkit engine not webtoolkit and chrome uses V8 as javascript engine and safari uses SquirrelFish
and opera uses KHTML engine  and Carakan as js engine , and IE uses Triednt Engine and use Chakra js engine in IE9 
the topic is really complex for implementing simple app just use a framework to handle it like JQuery Or Prototype
oh i forgot FF ,FF uses Gecko and SpiderMonkey as JS Engine
thanks Eslam for your informative comments :)
